body:
### Problem

No way to distinguish prompt message for `:tselect` because of empty kind.

### Steps to reproduce

init.lua:
```lua
local api = vim.api
local ns = api.nvim_create_namespace('messageRedirection')

local function log(msg)
  api.nvim_buf_set_lines(1, -1, -1, true, vim.split(msg, '\n'))
  vim.cmd.normal 'G'
end

local function detach()
  vim.ui_detach(ns)
  vim.schedule(function ()
    api.nvim__redraw({flush = true})
  end)
end

api.nvim_create_autocmd('CmdlineEnter', {callback = detach})

local function attach()
  api.nvim__redraw({flush = true})
  vim.ui_attach(ns, {ext_messages = true, ext_cmdline = false}, function (event, kind, content, replace)
    if event ~= 'msg_show' then return end
    if kind == 'return_prompt' then
      api.nvim_input('\r')
      return
    end

    vim.schedule(function ()
      log(vim.inspect({k = kind or 'none', c = content or 'none'}))
      api.nvim__redraw({flush = true})
    end)
  end)
end

api.nvim_create_autocmd({'CmdlineLeave'}, {callback = attach})
api.nvim_create_autocmd({'UIEnter'}, {callback = attach})
```
- `nvim -u init.lua`
- type `:h<CR>:ts<CR><Esc>ZQ`
- see the empty kind. 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3ffadaba-241f-48f9-824b-a72debd99888)


I see that 
```diff
diff --git a/src/nvim/tag.c b/src/nvim/tag.c
index c676b00986..ab5bba840d 100644
--- a/src/nvim/tag.c
+++ b/src/nvim/tag.c
@@ -813,6 +813,7 @@ static void print_tag_list(bool new_tag, bool use_tagstack, int num_matches, cha
   if (msg_col == 0) {
     msg_didout = false;     // overwrite previous message
   }
+  msg_ext_set_kind("tselect");
   msg_start();
   msg_puts_hl(_("  # pri kind tag"), HLF_T, false);
   msg_clr_eos();
```
can fix this issue, but gave up on writing the correct test case.  

### Expected behavior

Messages from `:ts` have kind. Not sure whether it should be other than `list_cmd` because it seems to describe a similar way of choice. 

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

v0.11.0-dev-1680+g77be44563a

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

n/a

### Operating system/version

Debian Sid

### Terminal name/version

alacritty 

### $TERM environment variable

alacritty

### Installation

from repo

labels.description: UI extensibility, events, protocol, externalized UI
labels.name: ui-extensibility

title: UI: missing kind for `:tselect` messages
